citeinfo.title: Key diagnostics and overall assessments of metabolism model performance

descript.abstract: Estimates of gross primary productivity, ecosystem respiration, and gas exchange coefficients for 356 streams and rivers across the continental United States. This data set contains the following parameters (defined below): site, resolution, K600_daily_sigma_Rhat, err_obs_iid_sigma_Rhat, err_proc_iid_sigma_Rhat, K_median, K_range, neg_GPP, pos_ER, model_confidence, site_min_confidence, site_confidence, .
descript.purpose: To bring metabolism data to the world!

place.placekt: Department of Commerce, 1995, Countries, Dependencies, Areas of Special Sovereignty, and Their Principal Administrative Divisions, Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) 10-4, Washington, D.C., National Institute of Standards and Technology

U.S. Department of Commerce, 1987, Codes for the identification of the States, the District of Columbia and the outlying areas of the United States, and associated areas (Federal Information Processing Standard 5-2): Washington, D. C., NIST

idinfo.useconst: None, but see Distribution Liability below. Users are advised to read the associated publication thoroughly to understand appropriate use and data limitations.

cntperp.cntorg: U.S. Geological SurveyEcologist, Data Science Branch, Integrated Information Dissemination Division, U.S. Geological Survey

idinfo.datacred: This work was funded by the USGS Powell Center (Working Group title: "Continental-scale overview of stream primary productivity, its links to water quality, and consequences for aquatic carbon biogeochemistry"). Additional financial support came from the USGS NAWQA program and Office of Water Information. NSF grants DEB-1146283 and EF1442501 partially supported ROH. The USGS Wisconsin Modeling Center provided access to the HTCondor cluster for generating metabolism estimates.

attracc.attraccr: No formal attribute accuracy tests were conducted.

horizpa.horizpar: A formal accuracy assessment of the horizontal positional information in the dataset was not conducted.

vertacc.vertaccr: A formal accuracy assessment of the vertical positional information in the dataset was not conducted.

procstep.procdesc: Metabolism was estimated using the streamMetabolizer package (Appling et al. 2018), and these key diagnostics and assessments were derived from the model outputs. Raw outputs and additional diagnostics are available in the "fit" output files included in this data release.

enttyp.enttypd: Key diagnostics and overall assessments of metabolism model performance. See the accompanying publication for rationale for these specific diagnostics.

attr.attrdef: Site identifier, consisting of prefix "nwis_" and the USGS National Water Information System (NWIS) site ID.
The temporal resolution of the input data (time between successive observations) for those dates fitted by this model.

R-hat statistic of the MCMC sampling for the K600_daily_sigma parameter, giving the fitted estimate of the standard deviation of K600_daily values relative to the exp(K600_daily_predlog) values on the same dates. Values near or below 1.05 indicate convergence of the MCMC chains.

R-hat statistic of the MCMC sampling for the err_obs_iid_sigma parameter, giving the fitted standard deviation of observation errors (differences between observed and modeled oxygen concentrations). Values near or below 1.05 indicate convergence of the MCMC chains.

R-hat statistic of the MCMC sampling for the err_proc_iid_sigma parameter, giving the fitted standard deviation of process errors (differences between rates of oxygen concentration change as modeled by the overall state-space model and the deterministic component of the model). Values near or below 1.05 indicate convergence of the MCMC chains.
Median of the daily estimates of the K600_daily parameter, where K600_daily is the mean reaeration rate coefficient, scaled to a Schmidt number of 600.
Difference between the 90th and 10th quantiles of the daily estimates of the K600_daily parameter, where K600_daily is the mean reaeration rate coefficient, scaled to a Schmidt number of 600.
Percent of daily estimates of gross primary productive (GPP) that are negative (unrealistic).
Percent of daily estimates of ecosystem respiration (ER) that are positive (unrealistic).
Assessment of overall confidence in the model based on other diagnostics in this table, scored as "L" (low confidence), "M" (medium), or "H" (high).
Least-confident assessment rating of all models for this site, scored as "L" (low confidence), "M" (medium), or "H" (high).
All unique assessment ratings of models for this site, scored as "L" (low confidence), "M" (medium), or "H" (high), and comma-separated when multiple unique ratings exist.

cntaddr.address: Denver Federal Center, Building 810, Mail Stop 302

distinfo.distliab: This information is preliminary or provisional and is subject to revision. It is being provided to meet the need for timely best science. The information has not received final approval by the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) and is provided on the condition that neither the USGS nor the U.S. Government shall be held liable for any damages resulting from the authorized or unauthorized use of the information.

digtinfo.formname: tab-separated values, compressed from text to .zip format

cntinfo.cntpos: Chief, Data Science Branch, Integrated Information Dissemination Division, U.S. Geological Survey
